name: The Only One (Velvetlobster)
description:
a puzzle "the remaining one" type of game attempt for the gmtk game jam 

The idea here is a puzzle like thing in which all white circles move at the same time and your objective is to kill them so to have only one arrive at the target, with minimal movement.

Each circles counts steps as they move (only the ones that actually move count as a step, so if they collide or hit a wall, it does not count as a step)

Each map has a max number of movements you should use to get to the target, however, the game will not restart by itself to allow you to study the arena before restarting (don't actually know if that was good or not).

If you get stuck just move to the next arena by clicking on the arrows on the sides, after you win an arena the target will be shown blue

I should be updating this in the next hours so if you can, tell me what you think of it.

ASWD TO MOVE
R TO RESTART
get one into the target point with less steps than the limit
collide 2 circles to destroy them
each one that moves counts as a step
steps ending in destruction do not count

btw ... it is kinda a bug/feature thing that the last step does not count if all balls are destroyed at once
